Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which the U.S. nuclear arsenal has been improved under President Trump's watch.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that previous presidents have also issued orders to modernize and renovate the nuclear arsenal.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that the nuclear arsenal is "far stronger and more powerful than ever before."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the improvements made to the nuclear arsenal are solely due to President Trump's actions, ignoring the ongoing multiyear program started under his predecessor.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the improvements mentioned in the claim are part of a larger, ongoing program that was initiated before President Trump took office.
